sect2.title: Syntax
sect2.synopsis: <!ELEMENT execute ((param | prefix)*)> <!ATTLIST execute base CDATA #IMPLIED command CDATA #REQUIRED>
sect2.para: This element occurs in the elements : |

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: The element execute is one of the many main operation elements. It is used to execute an arbitrary command.
The sub-element param contains one or many optional parameters of the command.
The sub-element prefix contains any prefix data for the command to execute.
Both sub-elements are optional, but if used can be used more than once.
The attribute base allows you to specify the directory in which the command will be executed. See .
The attribute command contains the text of the command itself.
